intro: Randia myrmecophylla var. typica, commonly known as the hairy randia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. The plant has a woody stem and produces elliptical leaves with a distinctive hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique appearance and growth habits make it a notable species within the Rubiaceae family.
